page.title: 15Diamond Riding, Carshalton.
page.content: The Diamond Riding Centre is a riding centre for handicapped people, attached to Queen Mary's Children's Hospital, and a variety of handicapped people benefit enormously from the riding. Both mentally and physically handicapped people ride, some are wheel-chair bound, so there is a mounting block for those with difficulty. The centre was opened in May l974 by Princess Anne. When you arrive at the centre sited on Woodmansterne Road, Carshalton, opposite Oaks Park, one of the first things that catches your eyes is the Diamond emblem designed by Norman Thelwell. It is of a child sitting astride a Thelwellian pony; the child carries a crutch instead of a crop.The Local Authorities contribute 45O pounds towards cost. All riders pay something.
